name: Wormhole Daemons of Lust
background:
The Wormhole Daemons are monstrous servants of the Havoc Gods who emerge from a different dimension throughout the galaxy. Their forms vary greatly, depending on which god they serve.

Wormhole Daemons are cast offs of dying gods who desperately hope to buy more time for themselves. These Daemons emerge suddenly from wormholes throughout the galaxy, to serve the eldritch will of their gods, only to disappear just as quickly once they have achieved their ends. Their gods are ready to leave nothing but havoc in their wake, just in hopes of extending their own lives for a little longer.
backgroundFull:
For aeons, powerful beings resided in a place beyond space, between the wormholes. Pure psychic entities, they lacked physical form and lived without fear of pain or death. Little can be said for certain about these beings or their origins, as their existence predates the records of even the oldest known civilizations in the galaxy. They observed passively, watching the galaxy progress, but rarely interacted with the species that lived within.

This changed suddenly, when one of their species died. Many have speculated about the cause of this death, but so far the matter remains a mystery. This was the first time one of their kind had experienced death, and others reacted first with curiosity, followed by horror. The horror only grew worse as death began to spread. The deaths started to mount and the rest began to recognize the signs of entropy and decay in themselves.

Each entity would react in their own way, but most would eventually succumb with few exceptions. The being now known as Lust sought to cut away at itself, slicing any signs of imperfection and weakness. Another known as Change, sought to accumulate knowledge more quickly than it could decay. Plague found salvation in physical form, using its power to spread itself and re-assimilate any that it infected. Finally, War learned to draw strength from those it slew.

Soon, these beings turned their attention outwards, hoping that the material world might allow them to stall their demise for a time longer. Anguished to survive, they sought out followers from the lost and desperate and offered them power in exchange for their service and worship. Those who rejected these gods came to know them as Havoc Gods due to the zealotry of their followers and the unrest that they caused.

These Gods are able to manifest their will in the physical world through aspects, fragments of their power and minds, which most refer to as their Daemons. Once manifested, these aspects are mortal, and vulnerable to death and harm, needing food to survive, and which can even adapt and change with experience. Gods must sacrifice a portion of their power to create Daemons, with greater Daemons requiring more of their essence to be contributed. As such, each Havoc God can only manifest so many Daemons at once, and must lose a portion of their power to do so, claiming it back when a Daemon dies.

When they are not carrying out the will of their gods, the Daemons often dwell within a strange space between Wormholes. Their control over these wormholes allows them to appear and disappear within physical space rapidly, allowing them to carry out their Godâ€™s will without fear of reprisal.

How will you serve the will of your god?

spells.name: Combat Ecstasy
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 18", which friendly units gets Quick Shot against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (this._skirmish ? 1 : this.AuraSize), avgUnit: true }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Beautiful Pain
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 2 hits with Shatter.

spells.name: Blissful Dance
spells.effect: Pick up to two friendly units within 12", which get Melee Evasion once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Total Seizure
spells.effect: Pick one enemy model within 18", which takes 4 hits with AP(1).

spells.name: Lust Boon
spells.effect: Pick up to three friendly units within 12", which get Lustbound Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Overpowering Lash
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 6 hits with AP(1) and Shred.

specialRules.name: Sergeant
specialRules.description: When this model attacks, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Counter-Attack
specialRules.description: Strikes first when charged.

specialRules.name: Armor
specialRules.description: Counts as having Defense X+.

specialRules.name: Ambush Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Ambush.

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Piercing Assault.

specialRules.name: Retaliate
specialRules.description: When this model takes a wound in melee, the attacker takes X hits.

specialRules.name: Counter-Attack Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Counter-Attack.

specialRules.name: Strider Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Strider.

specialRules.name: Hit & Run Fighter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Hit & Run Fighter.

specialRules.name: Surge
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit, this weapon deals 1 extra hits (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Storm of Lust
specialRules.description: Once per game, when this model is activated, before attacking, roll 3 dice. For each 2+ one enemy unit within 12" takes 3 hits with Surge (roll one die per hit to see if it triggers).

specialRules.name: Lustbound Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Lustbound, it moves +2" on Advance and +6" on Rush/Charge from Lustbound (instead of only +1" and +3").

specialRules.name: Lustbound
specialRules.description: Moves +1" when using Advance, and +3â€ when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: Mind Control
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one enemy unit within 18", which must take a morale test. If failed you may move it by up to 6" in a straight line in any direction.

specialRules.name: Quick Shot Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one enemy unit within 18", which friendly units gets Quick Shot against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Hit & Run Fighter
specialRules.description: Once per round, units where all models have this rule may move by up to 3" after being in melee.

specialRules.name: Resistance
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 6+ it is ignored. If the wounds were from a spell, then they are ignored on a 2+ instead.

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault
specialRules.description: This model gets AP(+1) when charging.

specialRules.name: Spawn
specialRules.description: Once per game, when this model is activated, you may place a new unit of X fully within 6" of it.

specialRules.name: Shatter
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and against units where most models have Tough(3) to Tough(9), this weapon gets AP(+2).

specialRules.name: Unstoppable when Shooting Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Unstoppable when shooting.

specialRules.name: Lustbound Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Lustbound Boost.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9â€ away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush canâ€™t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: Counter
specialRules.description: Strikes first with this weapon when charged, and the charging unit gets -1 total Impact rolls per model with Counter.

specialRules.name: Strider
specialRules.description: May ignore the effects of difficult terrain when moving.

specialRules.name: Hit & Run
specialRules.description: Once per round, units where all models have this rule may move by up to 3" after shooting or being in melee.

specialRules.name: Quick
specialRules.description: Moves +2" when using Advance, and +2â€ when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: Quick Shot
specialRules.description: This model may shoot after using Rush actions.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Ignores Regeneration
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores Regeneration.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model must take X wounds before being killed. If a model with tough joins a unit without it, then it is removed last when the unit takes wounds. You must continue to put wounds on the tough model with most wounds in the unit until it is killed, before starting to put them on the next tough model (heroes must be assigned wounds last, even if already wounded).

specialRules.name: Unstoppable
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and ignores all negative modifiers to this weapon.

specialRules.name: Melee Evasion
specialRules.description: Enemies get -1 to hit rolls in melee when attacking units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.
